org.jpws.front

Class MirrorFileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.front.MirrorFileManager

  • public class MirrorFileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that allows automated mirroring of data files into copies or other kind of representations on a separate storage area (currently on local disk space) on a frequent basis.

    Data handling classes which implement the MirrorableFile interface can hereby create relation to automated data saving (mirroring mechanism) which runs silently in the background. In the regular case this mechanism would function as a safeguard parallel to user-triggered save operations, but other solutions are possible.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MirrorFileManager

        public MirrorFileManager(java.io.File rootDirectory,
                         int period)
        Creates a new mirror file manager with the same background thread priority as the calling thread.
        Parameters:
        rootDirectory - File location of mirror files
        period - int time in seconds between file investigation loops

      • MirrorFileManager

        public MirrorFileManager(java.io.File rootDirectory,
                         int period,
                         int threadPriority)
        Creates a new mirror file manager.
        Parameters:
        rootDirectory - File location of mirror files
        period - int time in seconds (>0) between file investigation loops
        threadPriority - int thread priority setting for this manager's background tasks

    • Method Detail

      • setMirrorFilePrefix

        public void setMirrorFilePrefix(java.lang.String prefix)
        Sets the filename prefix for mirror files. The prefix can be left void by setting it to "" or null. It has a default value of DEFAULT_MIRROR_PREFIX.
        Parameters:
        prefix - String, may be null

      • setMirrorFileSuffix

        public void setMirrorFileSuffix(java.lang.String suffix)
        Sets the filename extension (suffix) for mirror files. The suffix must not be void. It has a default value of DEFAULT_MIRROR_SUFFIX.
        Parameters:
        suffix - String, may be null

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Causes the file-controlling thread of this manager to pause execution until a call to resume() occurs. (After calling this method it is still possible that an ongoing mirror-save thread is executing, however it is guaranteed that no new manager thread is scheduled.)

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Causes the file-controlling thread of this manager to resume execution if it is in PAUSE state.

      • exit

        public void exit()
        Terminally stops execution of the file-controlling thread. No further call-back functions or event dispatches will be executed.

      • invokeMirrorActivity

        public void invokeMirrorActivity()
        Triggers off mirror save activity for all registered mirrorable files. The save is only performed on files with an open modified marker. This command is designed to provoke immediate action from the controller thread and ends a possible sleeping state. CAUTION! This command is not required for regular execution of the manager's controller!

      • getMirrorRootDirectory

        public java.io.File getMirrorRootDirectory()
        Returns the root directory for the manager to store and retrieve mirror files. The rendered file is an absolute path.
        Returns:
        File mirror manager root directory

      • getCurrentMirror

        public java.io.File getCurrentMirror(MirrorFileManager.MirrorableFile f)
        Returns the mirror-file of the current program session for the given mirrorable file or null if it doesn't exists. (For deleting the mirror file, method removeCurrentMirror() should be used to allow the manager for proper state updates.)
        Parameters:
        f - MirrorableFile
        Returns:
        File current session mirror file or null if unavailable

      • getHistoryMirrorIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.io.File> getHistoryMirrorIterator(MirrorFileManager.MirrorableFile f)
        Returns an iterator over all known history mirrors for a given mirrorable file. History mirrors are mirror files of previous program sessions. They can amount to any number. iterator.remove() does not delete any file . It is save to delete rendered files at any time as they do not interfere with the file mirror mechanics.
        Parameters:
        f - MirrorableFile
        Returns:
        Iterator<File> history mirror files or null if no files found

      • removeHistoryMirrors

        public boolean removeHistoryMirrors(MirrorFileManager.MirrorableFile f)
        Removes all history mirror files of the given mirrorable file. (This also removes the specific history directory for this file if the directory is empty after deletion of the mirrors.)
        Parameters:
        f - MirrorableFile
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if all listed mirror files were deleted. On false the appl. should check getHistoryMirrorIterator() for files which could not get deleted.

      • removeCurrentMirror

        public void removeCurrentMirror(MirrorFileManager.MirrorableFile f)
        Removes the current session mirror of the given mirrorable file. If a current mirror save thread is ongoing, deletion takes place immediately after saving has terminated.
        Parameters:
        f - MirrorableFile

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<MirrorFileManager.MirrorableFile> iterator()
        Iterator over contained mirrorable files.
        Returns:
        Iterator<MirrorableFile>

      • controlMirrors

        protected void controlMirrors(MirrorFileManager.MirrorFileAdminRecord admin)
        This method checks whether a mirror of the mirrorable file is present in the current mirror directory. If so, it moves the mirror file (renamed) into a special directory for the mirrorable and informs the user about its existence.

      • addMirrorable

        public void addMirrorable(MirrorFileManager.MirrorableFile f)
        Adds a mirrorable file to administration in this manager.
        Parameters:
        f - MirrorableFile

      • removeMirrorable

        public void removeMirrorable(MirrorFileManager.MirrorableFile f)
        Removes the given mirrorable file from administration in this mirror file manager. This does not perform any removal of mirror files! After the mirrorable file has been removed, this manager cannot remove any of its mirror files.
        Parameters:
        f - MirrorableFile

      • getFileAdminRec

        protected MirrorFileManager.MirrorFileAdminRecord getFileAdminRec(MirrorFileManager.MirrorableFile f)
        Returns the file administration record for a specific mirrorable file or null if it doesn't exists.
        Parameters:
        f - MirrorableFile
        Returns:
        MirrorFileAdminRecord or null
